passage.title: Harvard University
passage.paragraph: Harvard is the oldest university in America. It starts in 1636. Two year later, a young priest, John Harvard, dies. He leaves his books and a lot of land to the university. Then, the university changes its name to Harvard.
At first, Harvard is very small. Slowly, it becomes bigger and bigger. The medical school starts in 1782. In 1908, the business school opens. Now, Harvard students can study many different things.

Many famouse people once study at Harvard. US presidents, writers, business people, and other important people are once students there. Now, people all over the world go to Harvard for their education.
